title: Jeremy McConnell gets baby bag ready for his 'Princess' after insisting he's there for Caben
text:

Jeremy McConnell has been busy packing his hospital bag ahead of the arrival of his baby girl.

He's expecting a little 'Princess' with girlfriend Katie McCreath, who is due to give birth in December.

And the former model and Celebrity Big Brother star is doing everything he can to become a doting dad.

He already has a son, Caben-Albi, who he shares with ex-girlfriend Stephanie Davis.

It's believed he hasn't seen Caben, two, for a long time, but Jeremy recently hit back at claims he was "neglecting" the youngster.

He told MailOnline : "Anyone that has half a brain cell needs to understand the reason I am not part of Caben's life is because not every situation can be fixed."

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

He added: "I protect my son as much as I can. It's not neglecting, it's protecting. I'm a very loving father. This is better for Caben.

"My priority is my baby girl because it's in my control – I have rights over that. My main focus is my girl."

He's been praised by his pregnant other half Katie, who says he's more organised than she is when it comes to preparing for the arrival of their baby.

She took to Instagram to share a snap of the drawers in her nursery packed to the brim with baby clothes and towels.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

On top, lies an overnight bag ready to be packed.

She wrote: "Time to pack the hospital bag Mr Organised @jeremymcconnellcooke is on it tonight with the list .... I’m Mrs Last minute so it will be strange been so on schedule

"I’ve got big pants and some comfy slippers for me spritz for bitz on order ... and all the basics for her ! Less than 7 weeks to go

"Thanks for the tips I’ve already had and to @hfreckles1983 for my super organisation list! Which has been a bible so far!

(Image: Instagram)

"I don’t want to take things out of my @babeek_official organised draws"

Jeremy also shared a snap of the bag on his Instagram Story, writing: "Getting the baby bag ready"

When Jeremy announced his baby news, he said he'd always wanted to be a dad.

He wrote: "Alot of things out there are not always how they are portrayed. I have wanted nothing more than to be a dad in life and I thank the people who have used their initiative to understand that. All I want is a happy family life away from any negativity."
